title: Chubu Electric Power RFC
text:
Chubu Electric Power Rugby Football Club are a <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> team, currently playing in the county's second tier <a href="Top%20Challenge%20League">Top Challenge League</a> competition. The team is the rugby team of electric utilities provider <a href="Chubu%20Electric%20Power">Chubu Electric Power</a>, based in <a href="Nisshin%2C%20Aichi">Nisshin</a>, <a href="Aichi%20Prefecture">Aichi Prefecture</a> of the <a href="Ch%C5%ABbu%20region">Chūbu region</a>. The team is also known as Chuden, an acronym of the company's name in Japanese, "Chūbu Denryoku".
In 1936, the Toho Electric Power company created a rugby union team; their operations were transferred to Chubu Electric Power according to Japan's <a href="National%20Mobilization%20Law">National Mobilization Law</a>, and the new Chubu Electric Power team was created in 1951. When rugby union in Japan was restructured in 2003 with the introduction of the <a href="Top%20League">Top League</a>, Chubu Electric Power was allocated to the second tier . They remained in that league until a further restructuring prior to the 2017–18 saw the team promoted to a newly established <a href="Top%20Challenge%20League">Top Challenge League</a>.
